purpose: Displays code insights as visual diagnostic messages (warnings, errors, info) in the VS Code Problems panel and editor gutter
userVisibleActions: See colored underlines/squiggles in code where insights are detected
View insights listed in the Problems panel (Ctrl+Shift+M)
Hover over underlined code to see insight descriptions
Click on problems to navigate to specific code locations
See insight severity indicated by icon color (error/warning/info)
developerVisibleActions: Developer triggers insight generation which updates diagnostics automatically
Diagnostics update in real-time as insights are discovered
Diagnostics are grouped by file for organized viewing
Diagnostics clear when insights are refreshed or extension is reset
Each diagnostic shows source as 'Shadow Watch' and includes insight ID

keyFunctions.name: updateDiagnostics
keyFunctions.desc: Updates all diagnostics across all files based on new insights
keyFunctions.outputs: Visual diagnostics in editor and Problems panel

keyFunctions.name: updateDiagnosticsForFile
keyFunctions.desc: Updates diagnostics for a single specific file
keyFunctions.inputs: File URI and array of insights for that file
keyFunctions.outputs: Visual diagnostics for that file only

keyFunctions.name: createDiagnostic
keyFunctions.desc: Converts an insight into a VS Code diagnostic message with appropriate severity and location

keyFunctions.name: clear
keyFunctions.desc: Removes all diagnostic messages from the editor and Problems panel

intent: Bridges the gap between generated code insights and VS Code's native diagnostics system, making insights visible to users through familiar VS Code UI elements (squiggles, Problems panel) rather than requiring custom UI
